p: Binh Le et al. (2019) [ 60] analyzed thirty-seven Vietnamese essential oils (OE) against T. brucei brucei (Tbb) and cytotoxicity in mammalian cells (WI38, J774). The results showed a selective effect of four OEs extracted from three species of Zingiberaceae ( Curcuma longa, Curcuma zedoaria and Zingiber officinale) and one species of Lauraceae ( Litsea cubeba) with an IC 50 of 3.17 ± 0.72, 2.51 ± 1.08, 3.10 ± 0.08 and 2.67 ± 1.12 nL/mL, respectively, and SI > 10. Table 2 shows essential oils with trypanocidal activity against T. brucei.
